title: cray: spack tries to install to a system directory when using cmake module
body:
### Summary

On Titan (Cray XK7) spack (`develop` branch, 70a8219f9) successfully builds metis, but fails during the install when it tries to write to a system directory.  Interestingly, the directory it is trying to install to is where cmake was installed by OLCF admins using spack.

Note, the above problem occurs when I use the cmake module in my `packages.yaml`. When the path is specified as follows:
```yaml
  cmake:
    paths:
      cmake@3.9.0: /autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/titan/.swci/0-login/opt/spack/20170612/linux-suse_linux11-x86_64/gcc-4.3.4/cmake-3.9.0-owxiriblogovogl5zbrg45ulm3ln34cx
    buildable: False
```
the installation completes successfully.

### Expected Result

metis installed in my local spack directory.

### Actual Result

spack fails when trying to install metis to a system directory

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ ./bin/spack --debug --verbose install -v metis%pgi@17.9.0 target=interlagos &> usingModules.log 
```
[`usingModules.log`](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1856865/usingModules.log)

### Information on your system

This includes:

 1. which platform you are using: 
Titan Cray XK7
```console
$ ./bin/spack arch                                                                                                                                   
cray-cnl5-interlagos
```

 2. any relevant configuration detail:

packages.yaml
```yaml
packages:
  mpich:
    modules:
      mpich@7.6.3%cce@8.6.4 arch=cray-CNL-interlagos: cray-mpich
      mpich@7.6.3%pgi@17.9.0 arch=cray-CNL-interlagos: cray-mpich
    buildable: False
  cmake:
    modules:
      cmake@3.9.0: cmake3/3.9.0
    buildable: False
  all:
    compiler: [cce/8.6.4,pgi/17.9.0]
    providers:
      mpi: [mpich]
```
